recipesJson.name: Tide Pod
recipesJson.author: AutomaticFailure
recipesJson.description:
I figured since we are now eating em, we may as well vape em too.

This was quickly thrown together... never to be mixed again.

FA Whiskey - Gives it a bite. Something subtle in the backend to throw off everything. Adds that soapy hand sanitizer.

JF Marshmallow - The pods sit on a bed of chalk. At a higher percentage, the dry marshmallow adds to a whole bite.

FA Orange / Lime Tahity / Liquid Amber / HS Blueberry - Based off the blue and orange pods, easily needed a fruit note. Orange is self explanitory while the Blueberry needed a more 'green' note sting. The Lime Tahity brings on that Pledge lemon, while Liquid Amber gives a gel feel overall. 

CAP Jelly Candy - Some plastic note, almost waxy coating.

CAP Super Sweet - Wayne told me to.

reviews.text: I have eaten many Tide Pods, they are delicious. They did quite well  on the presentation to make them look like candy. However, this recipe does not give the same burning sensation and blisters in my mouth and throat that I really enjoy.  You don't truly experience Tide Pods until you are coughing up bloody chunks of flesh.  I wish I could give you a lower score,  due to lack of authenticity.  Maybe 20% TFA Juicy Peach will get you a little closer.

I had everything except JF Marshmallow, so I subbed some good ol' sidewalk chalk, ground up in a 10% dilution of PG by weight and used 3%.  I must say this recipe is spot on, and someone obviously spent the time to match everything perfectly.  Kudos!
